info.title: TradeInsight API
info.description:
Unlock the power of financial markets with TradeInsight. Our comprehensive API delivers real-time and historical market data for global exchanges, offering deep insights into instruments, order books, trading history, and issuer data. From stocks to ETFs, futures, and beyond, TradeInsight provides the tools you need to make informed decisions with confidence.

Leverage advanced search features to explore instruments by name, ticker, exchange, and even sustainability metrics. Our API also includes live streaming prices, issuer financials and ESG metrics, FX rates, and market news from multiple providers â€” all in one place.

x-seb-portal.summary: API for real-time and historical market data, including instruments, order books, and financial metrics.

tags.name: markets
tags.description: General market information, lists of exchanges, market states, and indices.

tags.name: instruments
tags.description: General instrument search and listing operations (e.g., search, screening).

tags.name: issuer-data
tags.description: Issuer and Company data, including identity, fundamentals, governance, and fund metrics.

tags.name: trading-and-liquidity
tags.description: Real-time pricing, bid/ask spreads, order book depth, trades, and trading rules.

tags.name: historical-data
tags.description: Time-series data, historical prices (OHLC), NAVs, and aggregated performance metrics.

tags.name: sustainability-esg
tags.description: ESG, Taxonomy, and sustainability data for both issuers and portfolios.

tags.name: product-structure
tags.description: Structural information for complex products (e.g., holdings, underlying assets, option/certificate terms).

tags.name: news
tags.description: News feeds, press releases, and related market commentary.

tags.name: conversion-rates
tags.description: Currency conversion and foreign exchange rates.

tags.name: not-implemented
tags.description: Planned feature. Will be added in a later version. The route is marked as deprecated as a warning though technically incorrect. Calling the route will result in a 501 Not Implemented response.

get.summary: Comprehensive health summary
get.description: Combined view of status, system/process metrics, and readiness summary.

get.summary: Health ping
get.description: Basic health status.

get.summary: Liveness
get.description: Liveness signal with system and process metrics.

get.summary: Readiness
get.description: Readiness including dependency checks and summary.

get.summary: Get a paginated list of all available markets and exchanges.
get.description: This endpoint provides a comprehensive, paginated list of Market Identifier Codes (MICs) currently supported by the API. It's essential for Product Managers needing to know which trading venues and exchanges are available for the end-customer offering, allowing for dynamic selection and display of trading options.

get.summary: Get detailed information about a specific market.
get.description: Retrieves static and operational details for a specific trading venue identified by its MIC. This includes the legal operating entity, trading hours, country of operation, and standardized market segments. Use this to display accurate regulatory and operational context when presenting a venue to a user.

parameters.name: mic
parameters.description: The unique MIC identifier for the market (Operating or Segment MIC).

get.summary: List and search for tradable instruments across the universe.
get.description: This powerful endpoint allows users to filter, search, and screen the entire instrument universe. It's the primary tool for building search functionality, category views, and instrument lists for the end-user application. Developers can combine filtering by MIC, ISIN, country, and instrument type to precisely target the instruments tradable on specific platforms, ensuring the user only sees relevant products. Pagination and sorting are supported for efficient client-side rendering.

get.summary: Get the core descriptive data, current price, and available features for a specific instrument.
get.description: Retrieves the canonical record for a single instrument, providing all essential information in one call: name, identifiers, listing details, tradability status, and the current market price. Critically, this response also includes the links object, which acts as a dynamic roadmap to all related sub-data (e.g., fundamentals, trading rules, history) specific to that instrument type (Stock, Fund, or Derivative). Use this as the foundation for the instrument detail page.

SwedishStockExample.summary: Stock (SEK) - Market Priced, Base currency match.

ForeignStockExample.summary: Stock (USD) - Market Priced, Base currency conversion (USD to SEK).

MutualFundExample.summary: Fund (EUR) - Single Value Priced (NAV), Base currency conversion (EUR to SEK).

ETFExample.summary: ETF (SEK) - Market Priced, Base currency match. (Hybrid Fund/Stock links).

ForexExample.summary: FOREX Spot (USDSEK) - Market Priced, Non-tradable (system dependent).

get.summary: Issuer information for corporate and exchange-traded entities.
get.description: Retrieves the static core data for the corporate entity (or equivalent) that issued the security (e.g., stocks, corporate bonds, most ETFs). This includes the company's address, contact details, official identifiers (like LEI), and key management contacts (CEO, CFO). It provides the foundational identity context required for compliance, due diligence, and information display on instrument detail pages.

get.summary: Issuer information for fund management and product documents.
get.description: Specifically targets fund instruments (mutual funds, certain ETPs). This endpoint provides data on the legal fund management company (Fund Manager/UCITS ManCo) and essential regulatory documentation links (e.g., KIID/KID, prospectus PDFs). This is critical for meeting regulatory obligations and ensuring the client can access required legal information prior to trading funds.

get.summary: Get issuer financial fundamentals and valuation data.
get.description: Provides the comprehensive set of Key Figures (Growth, Profitability, Risk) for the underlying issuer. Each metric is delivered as a MetricSeries, which includes the latest reported value and a short trend history. This endpoint is central for building analytical views, screening tools, and the financial context cards displayed to end-users.

get.summary: Get fund and portfolio specific risk and benchmark metrics.
get.description: Delivers a suite of portfolio-level quantitative metrics (e.g., Alpha, Beta, SRRI, Max Drawdown). Unlike corporate fundamentals, these metrics assess the fund's performance and risk relative to its market benchmark and are essential for sophisticated fund selection, comparison tools, and displaying regulatory risk indicators (SRRI).

get.summary: Get market rules and trading parameters for exchange-traded securities.
get.description: Provides the static trading rules and operational context necessary for placing and executing orders for exchange-traded instruments (stocks, ETFs, bonds, etc.). This includes settlement details, trading restrictions, price tick size, and any mandatory disclosures. Developers need this endpoint to accurately build the trading interface and enforce regulatory constraints based on the specific venue (MIC).

get.summary: Get operational cutoffs, settlement, and subscription/redemption rules for funds.
get.description: Provides the non-exchange-based operational rules required for processing mutual fund orders. This includes the daily order cutoff time, the frequency of NAV calculation, and the exact settlement timeline for subscriptions and redemptions. Essential for correctly informing the user about when their order will be executed and settled.

get.summary: Get real-time order book depth (top bids and asks).
get.description: Retrieves the best available bid and ask prices and associated volumes for the instrument from the primary trading venue. This information is crucial for displaying real-time market depth, calculating current liquidity, and determining the immediate cost of a trade (the spread). The optional OrderbookDepth parameter allows developers to specify how many levels of depth to retrieve.

get.summary: Get a feed of the most recent executed trades.
get.description: Provides a list of executed transactions, including the traded price, volume, and precise timestamp. This data is used to confirm recent market activity, track price movement after the last quote, and display the instrument's overall trading liquidity over a short time horizon.

get.summary: Get historical price series (OHLC) for exchange-traded securities.
get.description: Retrieves time-series data necessary for generating candlestick charts and performing technical analysis for instruments traded on exchanges (stocks, ETFs, etc.). The data format is typically Open, High, Low, Close (OHLC) prices and volume, allowing developers to build detailed historical visualizations and backtesting tools for securities. The window for the history can be defined by the client.

get.summary: Get historical Net Asset Value (NAV) prices for funds.
get.description: Retrieves the time-series of historical Net Asset Values (NAV) for fund instruments (mutual funds). Unlike OHLC, fund prices typically represent a single calculated daily value. This data is used specifically to track the long-term performance and calculate returns for fund instruments where trading is based on daily calculated NAVs.

get.summary: Get standardized aggregated performance metrics (e.g., Year-to-Date, 5-year return).
get.description: Provides a dense set of aggregated statistics over standardized time horizons (e.g., 1m, YTD, 5y). This endpoint delivers performance metrics calculated based on closing price, absolute change, and percentage change, as well as price extremes (highs/lows) during those periods. Furthermore, it includes derived technical analysis metrics such as the RSI (Relative Strength Index), crucial for building advanced charting and screening features for technical traders.

get.summary: Get corporate ESG ratings and non-portfolio sustainability data.
get.description: Retrieves sustainability metrics related to the issuer's corporate operations (e.g., the company that issued the stock or bond). This includes overall ESG risk ratings from providers, specific scores like the Carbon Reduction Ambition Score, and governance indicators. This endpoint is used for assessing the corporate behavior behind the security.

get.summary: Get EU Taxonomy alignment for the corporate issuer.
get.description: Retrieves data detailing the issuer's alignment with the EU Taxonomy regulation. This focuses on the corporate activities of the issuer, specifically detailing the percentage of revenue, CapEx, and OpEx that are considered Taxonomy-eligible and Taxonomy-aligned. This is a regulatory requirement for transparency on corporate climate transition efforts.

get.summary: Get aggregated ESG and sustainability metrics for fund holdings.
get.description: Provides portfolio-level sustainability data for collective investment schemes (funds, ETPs). The metrics are aggregated from the underlying holdings and include portfolio carbon intensity, controversial revenue exposures, and compliance with exclusion criteria. This is crucial for pre-contractual and periodic sustainability reporting (SFDR/MiFID II).

get.summary: Get aggregated EU Taxonomy alignment for fund holdings.
get.description: Provides the aggregated Taxonomy alignment data for the entire portfolio (funds, ETPs). This endpoint combines the underlying alignment data of the portfolio constituents into a single view, showing the weighted average alignment percentages. This is essential for fund managers and distributors to comply with regulatory disclosure requirements.

get.summary: Holdings
Fees
Retrieve a paginated, time-sorted list of news articles.
Retrieve a list of all available news sources/feeds.
Get a specific news article by ID.
Retrieve the authoritative list of FX rates used for system conversions.
get.description: This short, non-paginated list represents the official rates used for converting prices and balances within the system (Source B).

get.summary: Retrieve a single authoritative FX conversion rate by ID.

InstrumentId.description: The unique identifier for a specific instrument and its listing combination within the system. The ID format is hierarchical, starting with a 3-letter prefix indicating the Instrument Sub-Type, followed by relevant identifiers (ISIN, MIC, Currency) separated by underscores.

InstrumentIdentifiers.description: Unique codes and identifiers used to identify the instrument globally or within the trading venue/system.

ticker.description: The short code (ticker symbol) used on the primary listing venue.

mpid.description: The Morningstar Performance ID, often a critical identifier for Funds.

QuoteStatusEnum.description: Indicates the availability and quality of the last quote.

PriceBase.description: Base properties shared by all price representations.

currency.description: The currency of the price data.

last.description: The last known price or value.

previousClose.description: The price/value at previous close or calculation.

MarketPrice.description: Pricing information for tradable instruments with bid/ask spreads (Stocks, FX, etc.).

bid.description: Current highest price a buyer is willing to pay.

ask.description: Current lowest price a seller is willing to accept.

spread.description: The difference between the ask and bid prices.

SingleValuePrice.description: Pricing information for instruments with a single calculated value, such as Mutual Funds (NAV).

nav.description: Net Asset Value (NAV) per unit. This is the primary value for funds.

PriceInfoBase.description: Aggregated pricing info where the native instrument is market-traded (uses MarketPrice for both native and base).

quoteStatus.description: Indicates the status of the price quote (e.g., Realtime, Delayed, Closed).

allOf.description: Aggregated pricing info where the native instrument is market-traded (uses MarketPrice for both native and base).

native.description: The market price data in the instrument's primary currency.

base.description: The market price data expressed in the API base currency. Null if same as native.

allOf.description: Aggregated pricing info where the native instrument has a single calculated value (uses SingleValuePrice for both native and base).

native.description: The single-value price data in the instrument's primary currency.

base.description: The single-value price data expressed in the API base currency. Null if same as native.

PriceInfo.description: The pricing details, which vary depending on instrument type.

email.description: The contact email address for the company.

phone.description: The primary contact phone number for the company.

address.description: The physical address of the company's main office or headquarters.

incorporationDate.description: The date on which the company was legally incorporated.

sector.description: The sector to which the company belongs, based on its primary business activities.

subSector.description: The industry category of the company, providing more specific detail than the sector.

numberOfEmployees.description: The total number of employees working for the company.

date.description: The end date of the reported period (e.g., YYYY-MM-DD, YYYY-MM, or YYYY for annual data).

IssuerFundamentals.description: Aggregated key financial figures, grouped by business domain.

currency.description: The primary reporting currency for monetary figures within this response.

lastTrade.description: Most recent actual trade for the instrument.

volume.description: Accumulated traded volume for the current trading day.

turnover.description: Accumulated traded value for the current trading day (price Ã— volume).

vwap.description: Volume-weighted average price for the current trading day.

maxVolume.description: Highest volume among all bid/ask levels in the book.

refresh.description: Recommended refresh interval in seconds for this orderbook feed.

totalVolume.description: Total volume of trades in this list.

totalValue.description: Total value (turnover) of trades in this list.

vwap.description: Volume Weighted Average Price (VWAP) for trades in this list.

HistoryWindow.description: Enumeration of all possible time periods and resolutions for historical data.

srri.description: Synthetic Risk and Reward Indicator (SRRI) score 1-7 (value property).

trend.description: Directionality of emission development (e.g. decreasing, stable, increasing)

aggregationCoverage.description: Percentage of the portfolio covered by the taxonomy calculation.

ListingInfo.description: Represents where the instrument is listed, registered or priced.

mic.description: MIC or Segment MIC, if the instrument is exchange-listed.

country.description: Country of listing, registration or provider.

venue.description: Name of exchange, provider, registry, issuer or FX venue.

MIC.description: Market identifier code (Operating or Segment MIC)

ISIN.description: International Securities Identification Number (12 characters, starting with a 2-letter country code, followed by 9 alphanumeric characters and one check digit).

CurrencyCode.description: ISO 4217 Currency Code used across all Forex instruments.

TradingStatusEnum.description: Enumeration representing the trading status of the instrument.

isMarketOpen.description: Flag indicating if the market is currently open.

mic.description: The unique primary Market Identifier Code (MIC) for routing, matching either the Operating or Segment MIC.

provider.description: Name of the data provider for this market.

access.description: Access level of the market data (Realtime, Delayed, or Updated daily).

country.description: The country associated with the market.

instrumentTypes.description: List of data types available in this market.

todaysTradingHours.description: The current day's specific trading hours for this market.

operatingMic.description: The Operating MIC (Exchange) that this market belongs to.

segmentMic.description: The specific Segment MIC if this market represents a sub-segment. If present, it typically matches the primary 'mic' field.

startTime.description: Start time of regular market operations (UTC).

endTime.description: End time of regular market operations (UTC).

allDay.description: Flag indicating if the market operates all day.

minDelaySecs.description: Minimum delay in seconds for market data.

maxDelaySecs.description: Maximum delay in seconds for market data.

fullFeed.description: Flag indicating whether the market provides a full feed.

tradesAvailable.description: Flag indicating whether trade data is available.

buyerSellerAvailable.description: Flag indicating whether buyer and seller information is available.

decimals.description: The number of decimal places used in the market's pricing.

indices.description: The key indices or benchmark instruments associated with the market.

country.description: Country that this news source covers

id.description: Unique identifier for the news item.

instruments.description: A list of instruments related to the news article

CursorMeta.description: Metadata for cursor-based pagination, providing the total count and the specific tokens (cursors) required to construct links to the previous and next pages.

total.description: The total number of available records in the collection.

nextCursor.description: An opaque token (cursor) to retrieve the next page of results (null if on the last page).

prevCursor.description: An opaque token (cursor) to retrieve the previous page of results (null if on the first page).

InstrumentMetadataSortEnum.description: Sorting options based on descriptive metadata.

InstrumentPerformanceSortEnum.description: Sorting options based on trading activity and percentage changes.

FundMetricsSortEnum.description: Sorting options based on fund-specific risk and performance metrics (from FundMetrics).

ConversionCurrencyCode.description: Unique currency codes available in the conversion rates feed.

ConversionRate.description: The official FX rate used by the system for conversion between currencies, e.g., for displaying prices in the user's base currency.

conversionRate.description: The authoritative mid-rate used for conversion (quote / base).

updatedAt.description: The time the rate was last updated in the system.

ConversionRateEntity.description: An entity wrapper for a single authoritative ConversionRate, including self-link.

ConversionRateList.description: A list of authoritative ConversionRate entities.

upperBound.description: Upper bound of the price range for which this tick size rule applies.

size.description: The minimum price movement (tick size) for the given price range.

HealthCheck_Impact.description: Operational impact if the dependency fails.

BaseCurrency.name: base
BaseCurrency.description: Base currency. Converted prices in base currency will be added

OrderbookDepth.name: depth
OrderbookDepth.description: Number of orderbook levels to return

SearchQuery.name: query
SearchQuery.description: Freetext search query, e.g., for searching by name, ticker, or ISIN.

SortBy.name: sort
SortBy.description: The property, performance metric, or fund metric in which to sort the instruments.

SortOrder.name: order
SortOrder.description: The order in which to sort the instruments.

FilterByOperatingMICs.name: operatingMic
FilterByOperatingMICs.description: Filter by operating Market Identifier Code (MIC).

FilterByInstrumentTypes.name: type
FilterByInstrumentTypes.description: Types of instruments to filter (e.g., STOCK, FUND). Can specify multiple types.

FilterByInstrumentSubTypes.name: subType
FilterByInstrumentSubTypes.description: Sub types of instruments to filter (e.g., ETF, Preferred Stock).

FilterByCountries.name: countryCodes
FilterByCountries.description: Comma separated country codes in ISO 3166-2 format.

PageToken.name: pageToken
PageToken.description: Cursor/token for fetching the next page of results. Used instead of 'page'.

RateId.name: rateId
RateId.description: Identifier for the conversion rate, typically formatted as BASE_QUOTE (e.g., EUR_SEK).

UnauthorizedResponse.description: Unauthorized â€“ missing or invalid authentication.

ForbiddenResponse.description: Forbidden â€“ authenticated but not allowed to access this resource.

TooManyRequestsResponse.description: Too many requests â€“ rate limit exceeded.
